msItem.note: List of contents, 16th-cent., probably in the hand of Sir John Price
msItem.quote: Gregorii Nazanzeni Apologeticus. Eiusdem vii sermones. Expositio Baptisterii. Ambrosius de obseruantia episcoporum. Augustinus contra v hereses. Didimus de spiritu sancto. Duodecim abusiua.
msItem.note: Another hand entered this list also on the cover.
List of contents, in the main hand.
msItem.quote: Haec sunt quae continentur in hoc libro. Apologeticus Gregorii Nazanzeni et .vii. sermones eiusdem. Expositio baptisterii. Ambrosius de obseruantia episcoporum. Augustinus contra .v. hereses. Didimus de spiritu sancto. Duodecim abusiua.

msItem.rubric: (fol. 2r) Praefatio Rufini presbyteri de libris Gregorii.>

msItem.explicit: (fol. 28r) et pastores in Christo Ihesu domino nostro, cui gloria in saecula saeculorum Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit apologeticus sancti Gregorii Nazanzeni episcopi.

msItem.title: De epiphaniis siue De natiuitate Christi
msItem.rubric: (fol. 28r) Incipit liber eiusdem de epiphaniis siue de natali domini.
msItem.incipit: Christus nascitur gloriamini Christus in caelis
msItem.explicit: (fol. 35r) per ipsum Ihesum Christum dominum nostrum cui est gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum Amen.

msItem.title: De luminibus siue secundis epiphaniis
msItem.rubric: (fol. 35r) Incipit .ii. de luminibus quod est secundis epiphaniis.
msItem.incipit: Iterum Ihesus meus et iterum misterium
msItem.explicit: (fol. 43v) uestra fulgeat coram hominibus, per Christum dominum nostrum cui est gloria in saecula saeculorum Amen.
msItem.note: Fol. 43v has a vacant space for a rubric.

msItem.title: De pentecoste et spiritu sancto
msItem.incipit: (fol. 43v) De sollempnitate huius diei pauca dicenda sunt
msItem.explicit: (fol. 56v) exultatio sanctorum cum quo est deo patri gloria et potestas in spiritu sancto in saecula saeculorum Amen.

msItem.title: De semetipso de agro reuerso
msItem.rubric: (fol. 50v) Incipit quartus insemetipso de agro regressus.
msItem.incipit: Desiderabam uos o filii quia et pari mensura
msItem.explicit: (fol. 57v) fide probabili tibi gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum Amen.

msItem.title: De dictis Ieremiae
msItem.rubric: (fol. 57v) Incipit .v. de Ieremia dicta praesente imperatore apud quem et intercedit pro quodam periclitante.
msItem.explicit: (fol. 62v) misericordiam speramus per Christum dominum nostrum uiuentem secum et regnantem cum spiritu sancto in saecula saeculorum Amen.

msItem.title: De reconciliatione et unitate monachorum
msItem.rubric: (fol. 62v) Incipit .vi. de reconciliatione et unitate monachorum.
msItem.explicit: (fol. 71r) mentem custodiat corda uestra in Christo Ihesu domino nostro cui est gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum Amen.

msItem.title: De uastatione grandinis
msItem.rubric: (fol. 71r) Incipit .vii. de grandinis uastatione cum pater episcopus reticeret.
msItem.explicit: (fol. 78v) fructificauit primo in Christo Ihesu domino nostro, cui est gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum Amen.

msItem.author: Leidrad
msItem.title: De sacramento baptismi
msItem.note: (entered in new hand, blue ink; fol. 79r)
msItem.explicit: (fol. 91r) transferendo de regno ad regnum, rex regum et dominus dominantium.

msItem.author: Didymus Caecus of Alexandria
msItem.title: De spiritu sancto
msItem.author: tr. Jerome
msItem.rubric: (fol. 91r) Incipit liber Didimi de spiritu sancto.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Didimi de spiritu sancto.

msItem.author: Pseudo-Cyprian
msItem.title: De XII abusiuis saeculi
msItem.rubric: (fol. 120v) Incipit epistola sancti Cipriani martyris. de duodecim abusiuis.

msItem.author: Pseudo-Ambrose
msItem.title: Libellus de dignitate sacerdotali
msItem.rubric: (fol. 130r)Ambrosii Mediolanensis episcopi liber de obseruantia episcoporum incipit.
msItem.explicit: (fol. 135r) quae te sanctis dare promististi. Amen.

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Praefatio in libro Didymi Alexandrini De spiritu sancto
msItem.rubric: (fol. 135r) Incipit prefatio sancti Ieronimi presbiteri in Didimum de spiritu sancto. ad Paulinianum.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in modern pencil from 1 to 136, beginning on the final upper endleaf, in the upper right corner in Arabic numerals.
supportDesc.collation: a4 (1,2 pastedowns) + 1–108 1112 12–148 1512 168 (8 pastedown). The last quire is an addition but was probably made to be appended here, as is suggested by its equal layout and last text, Jerome’s preface to Didymus’s De spiritu sancto, absent from the text on fols. 91r–120v. dauid aperiat

layoutDesc.layout: 33 long lines. No prickings visible, ruled in drypoint. 155–165 90–95

handDesc.handNote: Hand A: fols. 2r–127v, a medium-quality English protogothic hand of s. xii2/4. This hand also executed the rubrics, bar the incipit in blue ink on fol. 78v, which is by a near-contemporary.
Hand B: fols. 130r–136v or quire 16, a medium-quality English protogothic hand of s. xii2/3; the rubrics on fols. 130r and 135v are in this or a new hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 2r: a green arabesque initial P, decorated in red and blue. The subsequent texts in the original unit (up to fol. 129) open with arabesque initials, with lesser or no decoration in one or two colours (red, blue, green). Fol. 135v: a red initial C, with a bearded face inside the lobe.

binding.p: Romanesque. Whittawed skin over oak boards. The binding represents an English technique known from only a few manuscripts. Christopher Clarkson, ‘A Hitherto Unrecorded English Romanesque Book Sewing Technique’, in Roger Powell: The Compleat Binder, J. Sharpe (ed.), Bibliologia, vol. 14 (Turnhout, 1996), pp. 215–239.

history.provenance: Cirencester Abbey (OSA). The book was recorded in the Registrum Angliae de libris doctorum et auctorum ueterum (R3.1; R18.2, 13, 14) in the fourteenth century and it appears in the list of the books of John Price’s donation to the College, an identification confirmed by the title on the cover in his hand.
John Price: a list contents in his hand (fol. ii verso). An identical book appears in Nomina Librorum Manuscriptorum ex Donatione Iohannis Prise Equitis Aurati Herefordiensis.
history.acquisition: Willed to Jesus College. Pressmarks: 91, ?15th cent. (spine); I Arch. I–3, 17th cent. (ink on paper); MS. Jesus Coll. E. 3, 19th cent. (printed on paper); fol. i recto: 2031 = 12, ?16th cent. (originally 12, the previous added); 1 Arch. 1–3, ?16th cent.; fol. 1r: numb 12, ?16th cent. Title on the cover, Gregor Nazien Opera, in a hand possibly appearing in Jesus College 2 as well.

source.p: Description by Samu Niskanen (January 2011), revised by Andrew Dunning (December 2022). Previously described:

listBibl.bibl: H. O. Coxe, Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque Oxoniensibus hodie adservantur (1852)

revisionDesc.change: Andrew Dunning revised description by Samu Niskanen.
